Package board

Class King

java.lang.Object
board.ChessPiece
board.King
public class King extends ChessPiece
This class represents a King, a chess piece that can move in any direction but only one space
Version:
1
Author:
Evan Liu

  • Field Details

    • moved

      public boolean moved
      whether or not the King has moved or not

  • Constructor Details

    • King

      public King​(boolean white, String name, boolean moved)
      creates a king, a chess piece that can move in any direction but only one space
      Parameters:
      white - whether it's a white piece or a black piece
      name - output string that will be shown in the ascii art
      moved - whether it has moved or not

  • Method Details

    • isValidMove

      public static boolean isValidMove​(int initial_col, int initial_row, int end_col, int end_row, ChessPiece[][] board, King o)
      This is a boolean method to check if the King can be moved from its initial spot to the end spot that we're trying to get to.
      Parameters:
      initial_col - initial column that the King resides in
      initial_row - initial row that the King resides in
      end_col - column that we're trying to move the Bishop to
      end_row - row that we're trying to move the Bishop to
      board - the 2D array of Chess pieces that contains the King
      o - the actual King object in the 2D array
      Returns:
      whether or not the move from [initial_row][initial_col] to [end_row][end_col] can be executed

    • kingCheck

      public static boolean kingCheck​(int row, int col, ChessPiece[][] board, ChessPiece o)
      makes sure the resulting move doesn't result in 2 kings next to each other
      Parameters:
      row - the row we're trying to move the piece into
      col - the column we're trying to move the piece into
      board - 2D array of ChessPieces to simulate a board
      o - the piece we are trying to move
      Returns:
      whether or not the piece will be next to a king when we move it

    • Check

      public static boolean Check​(int row, int col, ChessPiece[][] board, ChessPiece o)
      method to check if the King is being attacked by any piece, can also be used to decide if any piece can be captured
      Parameters:
      row - row the King is in
      col - column the King is in
      board - 2D array of chess pieces that has the King
      o - the King object
      Returns:
      if there's a piece directly attacking the ChessPiece parameter o

    • CheckUp

      public static boolean CheckUp​(int row, int col, ChessPiece[][] board, ChessPiece o)
      utilized as the Check method but for the space above the specified piece
      Parameters:
      row - row the King is in
      col - column the King is in
      board - 2D array of chess pieces that has the King
      o - the King object
      Returns:
      if there's a piece directly attacking the space above the King

    • CheckRight

      public static boolean CheckRight​(int row, int col, ChessPiece[][] board, ChessPiece o)
      utilized as the Check method but for the space right of the specified piece
      Parameters:
      row - row the King is in
      col - column the King is in
      board - 2D array of chess pieces that has the King
      o - the King object
      Returns:
      if there's a piece directly attacking the space right to the King

      Parameters:

    • CheckMate

      public static boolean CheckMate​(int row_king, int col_king, ChessPiece[][] board, ChessPiece o, int row_checkingPiece, int col_checkingPiece, ChessPiece checkingPiece)
      utilizes all above classes to determine if the King is in checkmate
      Parameters:
      row_king - row the king resides in
      col_king - column the king resides in
      board - 2D array of chess pieces to simulate a board
      o - the King object
      row_checkingPiece - row the piece that is attacking the king resides in
      col_checkingPiece - column the piece that is attacking the king resides in
      checkingPiece - the piece that is attacking the king
      Returns:
      if the King cannot move, and if the piece that is attacking the king cannot be captured/blocked
